ygData.subject: Re: Armor
ygData.msgSnippet: Such hostility over a game.  I m sure calling him (Jim) names really hurt his feelings.  I think both of you need to get a life and take a break from EQ if
ygData.messageBody:
Such hostility over a game. I'm sure calling him (Jim) names really
hurt his feelings. I think both of you need to get a life and take a
break from EQ if something this trivial sets you off on a rampage :)

> ----------
> From: Jason Coan[SMTP:COANJ@...]
> Reply To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Sent: Thursday, May 27, 1999 10:41 AM
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Armor
>
> From: "Jason Coan" <COANJ@...>
>
> I simply expect people not to FARM items.....greedy bastards.
>
> Well, I'm going to remove myself from the list. I don't care to be on a
> list where we have people activly encouraging people to be dicks and to
> activly prevent people who need items and are willing work for items, to
> be pushed aside by high level ass holes farming equipment for their low
> level buddies.
>
> And for the guy who accused me of flaming, this is a flame :) Its power
> gaming greedy bastard ass holes like Jim that are and will continue to
> ruin this game for everybody.
>
> Bye all, was fun, happy hunting all
>
> (btw, I hope a griffin kills you Jim then camps on your body for days
> until it and all your twinked equipment goes poof)
>
> >>> "Jim Peterson" <jim@...> 5.27.99 10:31:40 AM >>>
> From: "Jim Peterson" <jim@...>
>
> Then beat us to it. Geez, what do you expect? What did I just say? We
> can't get it if you do more damage. We have to win the spot quite a bit.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Sean.Clark@... <Sean.Clark@...>
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com <warriors_eq@onelist.com>
> Date: Thursday, May 27, 1999 11:26 AM
> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Armor
>
>
> >From: Sean.Clark@...
> >
> >Yes, Jim, there IS something wrong with it! When your guild is hogging
> up
> >the spawn points FARMING those tommies and other items YOU ARE KEEPING
> OTHER
> >PEOPLE FROM GETTING A SINGLE ITEM FOR THEIR OWN USE.
> >I'm sorry, but haven't you been paying attn to the posts on farming?
> >
> >-----Original Message-----
> >From: Jim Peterson [mailto:jim@...]
> >Sent: Thursday, May 27, 1999 8:47 AM
> >To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> >Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Armor
> >
> >
> >From: "Jim Peterson" <jim@...>
> >
> >I think it's perfectly feasible to have some in guild twinking. I've
> been
> >arming my warriors with tomahawks and bronze and my shamans with
> Screamers.
> >There is nothing wrong with it. We are starting a Guild Armory and
> >Treasury.
> >
> >
> >-----Original Message-----
> >From: Jason Coan <COANJ@...>
> >To: warriors_eq@onelist.com <warriors_eq@onelist.com>
> >Date: Thursday, May 27, 1999 10:42 AM
> >Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Armor
> >
> >
> >>From: "Jason Coan" <COANJ@...>
> >>
> >>I hate it when people get twinked out like you. Its people like you
> that
> >cause the camping problem. Your guildmates camped for their items, which
> I
> >don't have a problem with, the continued FARMING to get items for
> >guildmates, blah. I've never had a single magic item given to me, I've
> been
> >there beside my guild buds working to get my items the whole game......ok
> I
> >shut up now
> >>
> >>>>> "Dean Boyle" <gino_14@...> 5.26.99 9:19:28 PM >>>
> >>From: "Dean Boyle" <gino_14@...>
> >>
> >>Well I just got my SOW ring, Shiny Brass shield (Is it better then tower
> >>shield?) and my travelr's back-pack! Wow I have 1 SOW ring, one
> cuthroat
> >>ring and two onyx earrigns, man, I swing like a best couse my DEX is +2
> and
> >>I prob. run 3/5 faster! Plus with this travelr's back-pack it's great,
> >>everything that goes into it gest reduced in weight super light! Wow,
> Now
> >my
> >>weight is around 60/98 This rocks! HeY I'll find oue where and who you
> get
> >>the sSOW rings of off later tonight, I'm makeing my trip down to
> freeport
> >so
> >>WISH ME LUCK!!!
> >>
> >>Dealan, Karana Server
> >>
> >>----Original Message Follows----
> >>From: "Mifsud, Michael" <Michael.Mifsud@...>
> >>Reply-To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> >>To: "'warriors_eq@onelist.com'" <warriors_eq@onelist.com>
> >>Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Armor
> >>Date: Wed, 26 May 1999 13:39:55 +0900
> >>
> >>From: "Mifsud, Michael" <Michael.Mifsud@...>
> >>
> >>All the Bloodstained armour (tunic, mantle and gloves) can be looted off
> >the
> >>Skeletal Knight who resides in unrest. He conned red to me at level 20.
> >He
> >>has a harm touch of 350hp. He always comes with an entourage when
> pulled.
> >I
> >>was in a level 25 party when we killed him, and our lead tank (a ranger)
> >>nearly died in the battle (he had a slither of red left).
> >>
> >>But I am VERY interested in the SoW ring. Only item that does the same
> >>thing this ring you mentioned does, that I know off, are the journey man
> >>boots. Looking at getting these with a level 30 party.
> >>
> >> > ----------
> >> > From: Dean Boyle[SMTP:gino_14@...]
> >> > Reply To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> >> > Sent: Wednesday, May 26, 1999 4:45 AM
> >> > To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> >> > Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Armor
> >> >
> >> > From: "Dean Boyle" <gino_14@...>
> >> >
> >> > I'm not sure couse I'm getting a few from some Guild Members but If
> ican
> >> > recall he's hunting some tuff little critters in Unrest at lvl 13
> >> >
> >> >
